Question Text: What are some key features of the Alpha POS plan?
Response: Simply put, a retirement plan is a way for you to contribute pre-tax money to a special account. This money is intended to replace your income when you retire.When you put your money in this account, you don't have to pay taxes on it. Down the road, when the time comes to take out your money from your traditional retirement account, you will have to pay the standard income tax on it.

Question Text: What are some key features of the Alpha POS plan?

Question Text: What are some key features of the Alpha POS plan?

Question Text: Why purchase life insurance from Delta?
Response: Your family is your top priority. While your financial needs, goals and dreams will change, making sure your loved ones are protected will always be important. Life insurance can help provide peace of mind, knowing theyäó»ll be O.K. financially.While nothing could replace you, life insurance can ease the financial burden caused by an untimely loss. Life insurance provides a tax-free death benefit that your beneficiaries can use to pay your final expenses, reduce debt, cover medical bills and pay everyday living expenses like childcare, groceries and rent or mortgage payments.Life insurance proceeds can also help your loved ones maintain their lifestyle and help build their future äóñ such as continuing a hobby, funding a college education or saving for retirement.

Question Text: What is our performance review process?
Response: Performance reviews are held once a year, typically in April and May. You'll receive an invitation to complete your self-evaluation on your portal. Once your self-evaluation is complete, your manager will schedule your performance review with you.

Question Text: Understanding qualified expenses for my dependent care flexible spending account.
Response: Your Dependent Care FSA will cover expenses such as day care, preschool or nursery expenses, and elder care.Your dependent care FSA will not cover services such as tuition for dependents enrolled in kindergarten or higher grades, field trip fees, or overnight camp.

Question Text: Understanding how to complete an I-9 form.
Response: You're responsible for Section 1 of the I-9, which asks for your personal information. Remember, providing your phone number and email address is optional! Next, you'll need to bring in your documentation for review. You can bring documentation that verifies both your identification & right to work in the US, such as your passport, or you can bring in 2 separate pieces of documentation, such as your driver's license and your social security card. The documentation you bring must be on the USCIS approved lists, which are generally included on the I-9 form.

Question Text: What are some key features of the Alpha POS plan?
Response: The Alpha POS plan has a lower deductible with higher premiums.  You can use in-network or out-of-network providers, but you'll save money staying in-network. In-network preventive care is covered at no cost!

Question Text: What is a W-4?
Response: A W-4 is an IRS tax form that lets your employer know how much federal income tax will be withheld from your pay.  Be sure you complete it correctly, so you don't have a big balance due at tax time.

Question Text: What are Federal Withholding and State Withholding?
Response: Federal and state withholding are income taxes that are deducted from your paycheck. Your employer is required to withhold these deductions from your paycheck on your behalf.
